title: iMessage History: Boundary Violation & Privacy Breach
description: Text message history showing escalating pattern of enmeshment and privacy violations

message_history.message: Good morning sweetie! What are you eating for breakfast? Are you eating enough protein?
Just checking in! How was your morning? Did you take your vitamins?
I saw you were online but didn't respond. Everything okay? I'm worried.
Mom, I was just busy at work. I'm fine!
I noticed you lost weight in your last Instagram photo. Are you eating enough? Should I come over and make you dinner?
I'm eating fine Mom, I promise. I'm an adult, I can take care of myself üòä
I know honey, I just worry. That's what mothers do!
Just had my first therapy session. Dr. Chen was really helpful with my anxiety.
That's awesome! Proud of you for taking that step üí™
Second therapy session went well. Working on setting boundaries with family lol
Good for you!! You've got this üôå
Hi honey! I stopped by your apartment to drop off some leftovers. You weren't home so I used my key. Left food in your fridge! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Mom, I wish you'd text before coming over. I'm not always available.
I wanted it to be a surprise! You're so busy, I thought I'd help. Why are you upset?
Linda, I'm really worried about Sarah. I found some things when I was at her apartment yesterday.
What things? Is she okay?
She's seeing a therapist. For ANXIETY. Her phone was on the counter and I saw messages about it. I think she's really struggling mentally and won't tell me.
Oh no! That's concerning. Did you talk to her about it?
Not yet. I don't want her to know I looked at her phone. But I'm going to send her some articles about how therapy can make things worse. She needs to know.
Honey, I've been reading about therapy and I'm worried. A lot of therapists just want your money. Have you considered talking to Pastor Mike instead?
Mom, I'm fine. I don't need to talk to Pastor Mike.
I just think you should know that therapy can make mental health WORSE. I found this article...
[Link to anti-therapy article]
Mom, how do you even know I'm in therapy?
I saw it when I was at your place. Your phone was sitting there.
You went through my phone?!?
I didn't GO THROUGH it, it was just sitting there and I happened to see a message.
That's going through my phone. That's private.
I'm your MOTHER. I was just looking out for you! After everything I've done for you, this is how you treat me?
Hey sweetie, your mom mentioned you're going through a tough time. I'm here if you need to talk ‚ù§Ô∏è
What did she tell you?
Just that you're dealing with some mental health stuff. She's really worried about you.
You told Aunt Linda about my therapy?? Mom, that was PRIVATE.
She's FAMILY. And I'm worried about you! You're being so secretive and defensive. That's not healthy.
We need to talk about this. Can I call you tonight?
Fine. But I hope you'll be less hurtful. I was just trying to help.

context_notes.pattern_established: Escalating intrusive behavior: constant check-ins ‚Üí unannounced visits ‚Üí reading phone ‚Üí sharing private info
context_notes.emotional_manipulation: Uses 'I'm just worried' and 'after everything I've done' to justify violations
context_notes.boundary_history: Protagonist has tried gentle pushback ('I was busy', 'I'm an adult') but not firm boundaries yet
context_notes.triggering_incident: Mom read private texts about therapy, then told family about mental health without permission
context_notes.current_state: Protagonist needs to set firm boundary with consequences

roleplay_entry_point: The phone call where protagonist must address the privacy violation and set clear boundaries.
